intro: Lychnophorella, commonly known as the star-shaped liverwort, is a genus of mosses belonging to the family Lepidoziaceae. It is characterized by its small, leafy structures that often form dense, cushion-like growths on moist, shaded surfaces. The plants typically have a distinct, star-like appearance due to the arrangement of their thalloid bodies. Lychnophorella species are often found in temperate regions, thriving in humid environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. Their simple morphology and specialized habitat make them important indicators of ecological conditions in their native ecosystems.
